maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves Host Volume information from FlashArray.
Retrieves Host Volume information including volumes attributes from a FlashArray.
Required. FQDN or IP address of the FlashArray.
Required. FQDN or IP address of the FlashArray.

maml:alert.maml:para: This cmdlet can utilize the global $Creds variable for FlashArray authentication. Set the variable $Creds by using the command $Creds = Get-Credential.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Rerieves Host Volume information from the FlashArray myarray.mydomain.com.

maml:description.maml:para: Displays array hierarchy in relation to hosts and/or volumes.
This cmdlet will display the hierarchy from a FlashArray of hosts and volumes. The output is to the console in text.
Required. FQDN or IP address of the FlashArray.
Required. FQDN or IP address of the FlashArray.

maml:alert.maml:para: This cmdlet can utilize the global $Creds variable for FlashArray authentication. Set the variable $Creds by using the command $Creds = Get-Credential.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves and outputs to a file the configuration of the FlashArray.
This cmdlet will run Purity CLI commands to retrieve the base configuration of a FlashArray and output it to a file.
Required. FQDN or IP address of the FlashArray.
Optional. The FlashArray name to use in the output. Defaults to $EndPoint.
Optional. The file path and filename that will contain the output. if not specified, the default is the current folder\Array_Config.txt.
Optional. The FlashArray name to use in the output. Defaults to $EndPoint.
Required. FQDN or IP address of the FlashArray.
Optional. The file path and filename that will contain the output. if not specified, the default is the current folder\Array_Config.txt.

maml:alert.maml:para: This cmdlet can utilize the global $Creds variable for FlashArray authentication. Set the variable $Creds by using the command $Creds = Get-Credential.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the configuration for a FlashArray and stores it in the current path as Array100_config.txt.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves disconnected volume information for a FlashArray.
This cmdlet will retrieve information for volumes that are in a disconnected state for a FlashArray.
Required. FQDN or IP address of the FlashArray.
Required. FQDN or IP address of the FlashArray.

maml:alert.maml:para: This cmdlet can utilize the global $Creds variable for FlashArray authentication. Set the variable $Creds by using the command $Creds = Get-Credential.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves aged snapshots and allows for Deletion and Eradication of such snapshots.

This cmdlet will retrieve all snapshots that are beyond the specified SnapAgeThreshold. It allows for the parameters of Delete and Eradicate, and if set to $true, it will delete and eradicate the snapshots returned. It allows for the parameter of Confirm, and if set to $true, it will prompt before deletion and/or eradication of the snapshots. Snapshots must be deleted before they can be eradicated.
Required. Endpoiont is the FlashArray IP or FQDN.
Optional. If set to $true, delete the snapshots.
Optional. If set to $true, eradicate the deleted snapshots (snapshot must be flagged as deleted).
Required. SnapAgeThreshold is the number of days from the current date. Delete. Confirm, and Eradicate are optional.
Optional. If set to $true, provide user confirmation for Deletion or Eradication of the snapshots.
Optional. If set to $true, delete the snapshots.
Required. Endpoiont is the FlashArray IP or FQDN.
Optional. If set to $true, eradicate the deleted snapshots (snapshot must be flagged as deleted).
Required. SnapAgeThreshold is the number of days from the current date. Delete. Confirm, and Eradicate are optional.
Optional. If set to $true, provide user confirmation for Deletion or Eradication of the snapshots.

dev:type.maml:name: Returns a listing of snapshots that are beyond the specified threshold and displays final results.

maml:alert.maml:para: This cmdlet can utilize the global $Creds variable for FlashArray authentication. Set the variable $Creds by using the command $Creds = Get-Credential.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns all snapshots that are older than 30 days from the current date.
Returns all snapshots that are older than 30 days from the current date, deletes and eradicates them without confirmation.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves host Bus Adapater (HBA) information.
Retrieves host Bus Adapter (HBA) information for the host.
Optional. The computer name to run the cmdlet against. It defaults to the local computer name.
Optional. The computer name to run the cmdlet against. It defaults to the local computer name.
Retrieves the current MPIO Load Balancing policy for Pure FlashArray disk(s).
This cmdlet will retrieve the current MPIO Load Balancing policy for connected Pure FlashArrays disk(s) using the mpclaim.exe utlity.
Optional. If specified, retrieves only the policy for the that disk ID. Otherwise, returns all disks. DiskID is the 'Number' identifier of the disk from the cmdlet 'Get-Disk'.
Optional. File name to output results to. Defaults to %TEMP%\MPIOLBPolicy.txt
Optional. If specified, retrieves only the policy for the that disk ID. Otherwise, returns all disks. DiskID is the 'Number' identifier of the disk from the cmdlet 'Get-Disk'.
Optional. File name to output results to. Defaults to %TEMP%\MPIOLBPolicy.txt

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the current MPIO LB policy for disk ID 1.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves FlashArray volume serial numbers connected to the host.
Cmdlet queries WMI on the localhost to retrieve the disks that are associated to Pure FlashArrays.

dev:type.maml:name: Outputs serial numbers of FlashArrays devices.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns serial number information on Pure FlashArray disk devices connected to the host.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves all the Windows OS QFE patches applied.
Retrieves all the Windows OS QFE patches applied.

dev:type.maml:name: Outputs a listing of QFE patches applied.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the volume shadow copy informaion using the Diskhadow command.
This cmdlet will retrieve the volume shadow copy information.
Optional. Script text file name created to pass to the Diskshadow command. defaults to 'PUREVSS-SNAP'.
Required. Full filename for the metadata .cab file. It must exist in the current working folder.
Required. Name of the shadow copy alias.
Required. Drive letter, share, or mount point to expose the shadow copy.
Optional. "On" or "Off". If set to 'off', verbose mode for the Diskshadow command is disabled. Default is 'On'.
Required. Drive letter, share, or mount point to expose the shadow copy.
Required. Full filename for the metadata .cab file. It must exist in the current working folder.
Optional. Script text file name created to pass to the Diskshadow command. defaults to 'PUREVSS-SNAP'.
Required. Name of the shadow copy alias.
Optional. "On" or "Off". If set to 'off', verbose mode for the Diskshadow command is disabled. Default is 'On'.

maml:alert.maml:para: See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/administration/windows-commands/diskshadow for more information on the Diskshadow utility.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Exposes the MyAias shadow copy as drive latter G: using the myFie.cab metadata file.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a formatted report that contains FlashArray Capacity Information
This cmdlet will retrieve volume and snapshot capacity information from the FlashArray and output it to a formatted report.
Required. FQDN or IP address of FlashArray.
Optional. File name of output report. Default is Array_Capacity_Report.html.
Optional. Full folder path for output report. Default is the current %TEMP% folder.
Optional. Specic volumes to filter output on. Wildcards are accepted. By dafult, this is "*" (all).
Required. FQDN or IP address of FlashArray.
Optional. File name of output report. Default is Array_Capacity_Report.html.
Optional. Full folder path for output report. Default is the current %TEMP% folder.
Optional. Specic volumes to filter output on. Wildcards are accepted. By dafult, this is "*" (all).

dev:type.maml:name: Formatted HTML report containing retrieved data and specified options.

maml:alert.maml:para: This cmdlet can utilize the global $Creds variable for FlashArray authentication. Set the variable $Creds by using the command $Creds = Get-Credential.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a capacity report named myArray_Capacity_Report.html in the current folder.
Creates a capacity report c:\temp\myArrayReport.html that includes volumes that contain the name 'Volume1*'.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a Excel report on volumes connected to a Hyper-V cluster.

This creates seperate CSV files for VM, Windows Hosts, and FlashArray information that is part of a HyperV cluster. It then takes that output and places it into a an Excel workbook that contains sheets for each CSV file.
{{ Fill EndPoint Description }}
Optional. defaults to HypervClusterReport.xlsx.
Optional. defaults to FlashArrays.csv.
Optional. Defaults to VMs.csv.
Optional. defaults to WindowsHosts.csv.
{{ Fill EndPoint Description }}
Optional. defaults to HypervClusterReport.xlsx.
Optional. defaults to FlashArrays.csv.
Optional. Defaults to VMs.csv.
Optional. defaults to WindowsHosts.csv.

dev:type.maml:name: Endpoint is mandatory. VM, Win, and PFA csv file names are optional.
Outputs individual CSV files and creates an Excel workbook that is built using the required PowerShell module ImportExcel, created by Douglas Finke.

maml:alert.maml:para: This cmdlet can utilize the global $Creds variable for FlashArray authentication. Set the variable $Creds by using the command $Creds = Get-Credential.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-HypervClusterVolumeReport -EndPoint myarray -VmCsvName myVMs.csv -WinCsvName myWinHosts.csv -PfaCsvName myFlashArray.csv -ExcelFile myExcelFile

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will create three seperate CSV files with HyperV cluster information and incorprate them into a single Excel workbook.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new volume shadow copy using DiskShadow.
This cmdlet will create a new volume shadow copy using the Diskshadow command, passing the variables specified.
Required.
Optional. Script text file name created to pass to the Diskshadow command. Pre-defined as 'PUREVSS-SNAP'.
Required. Name of the shadow copy alias.
Optional. "On" or "Off". If set to 'off', verbose mode for the Diskshadow command is disabled. Default is 'on'.
Optional. Script text file name created to pass to the Diskshadow command. Pre-defined as 'PUREVSS-SNAP'.
Required. Name of the shadow copy alias.
Optional. "On" or "Off". If set to 'off', verbose mode for the Diskshadow command is disabled. Default is 'on'.
Required.

maml:alert.maml:para: See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/administration/windows-commands/diskshadow for more information on the Diskshadow utility.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds a new volume shadow copy of Volume01 using Diskshadow with an alias of 'MyAlias'.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets Pure FlashArray connected disks to online.
This cmdlet will set any FlashArray volumes (disks) to online in Windows using the diskpart command.
Optional. The computer name to run the cmdlet against. It defaults to the local computer name.
Optional. The computer name to run the cmdlet against. It defaults to the local computer name.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets all FlashArray disks for myComputer to online.

maml:description.maml:para: Reports on pending FlashArray Volume and Snapshot deletions and optionally Eradicates them.

This cmdlet will retrun information on any volumes or volume snapshots that are pending eradication after deletion and optionally prompt for eradication of those objects. The user will be prompted for confirmation.
Required. FQDN or IP address of the FlashArray.
Required. FQDN or IP address of the FlashArray.

dev:type.maml:name: Volume and volume snapshots awaiting eradication.

maml:alert.maml:para: This cmdlet can utilize the global $Creds variable for FlashArray authentication. Set the variable $Creds by using the command $Creds = Get-Credential.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the MPIO Load Balancing policy for FlashArray disks.
This cmdlet will set the MPIO Load Balancing policy for all connected Pure FlashArrays disks to the desired setting using the mpclaim.exe utlity. The default Windows OS setting is RR.

Required. No default. The Policy type must be specified by the letter acronym for the policy name (ex. "RR" for Round Robin). Available options are: LQD = Least Queue Depth RR = Round Robin FO = Fail Over Only RRWS = Round Robin with Subset WP = Weighted Paths LB = Least Blocks clear = clears current policy and sets to Windows OS default of RR

Required. No default. The Policy type must be specified by the letter acronym for the policy name (ex. "RR" for Round Robin). Available options are: LQD = Least Queue Depth RR = Round Robin FO = Fail Over Only RRWS = Round Robin with Subset WP = Weighted Paths LB = Least Blocks clear = clears current policy and sets to Windows OS default of RR

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the MPIO load balancing policy for all Pure disks to Least Queue Depth.
Clears the current MPIO policy for all Pure disks and sets to the default of RR.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the TLS Version in the local registry.
This cmdlet disables TLS version 1.0 and enables TLS Versions 1.1, 1.2, and 1.3 in the local registry. It will prompt for creating a backup of the registry before execution for recovery purposes.

dev:type.maml:name: Backup of the registry before the changes are implemented.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Prompts for creation of a registry backup, disables TLS version 1.0, and enables TLS versions 1.1, 1.2, and 1.3.

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet to set the Power scheme for the Windows OS to High Performance.
Cmdlet to set the Power scheme for the Windows OS to High Performance.
Optional. The computer name to run the cmdlet against. It defaults to the local computer name.
Optional. The computer name to run the cmdlet against. It defaults to the local computer name.

dev:type.maml:name: Current power scheme and optional confirmation to alter the setting in the Windows registry.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the current Power Scheme setting, and if not set to High Performance, asks for confirmation to set it.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves Protection Group (PGroup) information for the FlashArray.
Retrieves Protection Group (PGroup) infromation for the FlashArray.
Required. FQDN or IP address of the FlashArray.
Required. FQDN or IP address of the FlashArray.

maml:alert.maml:para: This cmdlet can utilize the global $Creds variable for FlashArray authentication. Set the variable $Creds by using the command $Creds = Get-Credential.

maml:description.maml:para: Synchronizes the hosts and host protocols between two FlashArrays.
This cmdlet will retrieve the current hosts from the Source array and create them on the target array. It will also add the FC (WWN) or iSCSI (iqn) settings for each host on the Target array.
Required. FQDN or IP address of the source FlashArray.
Required. FQDN or IP address of the source FlashArray.
Required. 'FC' for Fibre Channel WWNs or 'iSCSI' for iSCSI IQNs.
Required. 'FC' for Fibre Channel WWNs or 'iSCSI' for iSCSI IQNs.
Required. FQDN or IP address of the source FlashArray.
Required. FQDN or IP address of the source FlashArray.

maml:alert.maml:para: This cmdlet cannot utilize the global $Creds variable as it requires two logins to two seperate arrays.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Synchrnizes the hosts and hosts FC WWNs from the mySourceArray to the myTargetArray.

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet used to retrieve hosts information, test and optionally configure MPIO (FC) and/or iSCSI settings in a Windows OS against FlashArray Best Practices.

This cmdlet will retrieve the curretn host infromation, and iterate through several tests around MPIO (FC) and iSCSI OS settings and hardware, indicate whether they are adhearing to Pure Storage FlashArray Best Practices, and offer to alter the settings if applicable. All tests can be bypassed with a negative user response when prompted, or simply by using Ctrl-C to break the process.
Optional. Specify the full filepath (ex. c:\mylog.log) for logging. If not specified, the default file of %TMP%\Test-WindowsBestPractices.log will be used.
Optional. If this parameter is present, the cmdlet will run tests for iSCSI settings.
Optional. If this parameter is present, the cmdlet will run tests for iSCSI settings.
Optional. Specify the full filepath (ex. c:\mylog.log) for logging. If not specified, the default file of %TMP%\Test-WindowsBestPractices.log will be used.

dev:type.maml:name: Output status and best practice options for every test.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Run the cmdlet against the local machine running the MPIO tests and the log is located in the %TMP%\Test-WindowsBestPractices.log file.
Run the cmdlet against the local machine, run the additional iSCSI tests, and create the log file at c:\temp\mylog.log.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets Pure FlashArray connected disks to offline.
This cmdlet will set any FlashArray volumes (disks) to offline in Windows using the diskpart command.
Optional. The computer name to run the cmdlet against. It defaults to the local computer name.
Optional. The computer name to run the cmdlet against. It defaults to the local computer name.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Offlines all FlashArray disks from myComputer.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates drive letters and assigns a label.
Thsi cmdlet will update the current drive letter to the new drive letter, and assign a new drive label if specified.
Required. Drive lettwre without the colon.
Required. Drive lettwre without the colon.
Optional. Drive label text. Defaults to "NewDrive".
Required. Drive lettwre without the colon.
Optional. Drive label text. Defaults to "NewDrive".
Required. Drive lettwre without the colon.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates the drive letter from M: to S: and labels S: to NewDrive.
